revised_title: Experimental Technique for Determining Extinction Cross-Sections Using Open Resonators
tldr: The authors developed a new experimental method to determine the extinction cross-section of obstacles at microwave frequencies using an open resonator. The technique does not require measuring fields but only determines the Q-factor of the resonator. By measuring the Q-factor with and without the obstacle in two different positions, the extinction cross-section can be deduced. This method provides absolute values of scattering cross-sections and is essential for understanding the attenuation of microwaves in the atmosphere.
